attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4h0R9MrLnlB8NA86z_description
attribs.current:
You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a d6.
Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Bardic Inspiration die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Bardic Inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Your Bardic Inspiration die changes when you reach certain levels in this class. The die becomes a d8 at 5th level, a d10 at 10th level, and a d12 at 15th level.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4h0RAsbxrkuUruXjk_description
attribs.current: You can cast any bard spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4h0RAsbxrkuUruXjs_description
attribs.current: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4h0RAsbxrkuUruXjt_description
attribs.current: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4h0RAsbxrkuUruXju_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4h0RAsbxrkuUruXjv_description
attribs.current: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-Lf4h0RAsbxrkuUruXjw_name
attribs.current: Battleaxe, Hand Crossbow, Handaxe, Light Hammer, Longsword, Rapier, Shortsword, Simple Weapons, Warhammer

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4h0RBC0-w-IrgZMDz_description
attribs.current: You can always find a place to perform, usually in an inn or tavern but possibly with a circus, at a theater, or even in a noble’s court. At such a place, you receive free lodging and food of a modest or comfortable standard (depending on the quality of the establishment), as long as you perform each night. In addition, your performance makes you something of a local figure. When strangers recognize you in a town where you have performed, they typically take a liking to you.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Lf4h0RDna-A1Q0csSoh_spelldescription
attribs.current: This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range: You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Lf4h0RDna-A1Q0csSoi_spelldescription
attribs.current: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.  This spell’s damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Lf4h0RDna-A1Q0csSoi_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature you can see and that can hear you within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RDna-A1Q0csSoj_spelldescription
attribs.current: You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RDna-A1Q0csSoj_spelltarget
attribs.current: A humanoid you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RDna-A1Q0csSoj_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxH9_spelldescription
attribs.current: For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text. This spell doesn’t decode secret messages in a text or a glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn’t part of a written language.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxH9_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A pinch of soot and salt

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHA_spelldescription
attribs.current: For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any. The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHB_spelldescription
attribs.current: This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures). Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature’s hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature’s hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected. Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren’t affected by this spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHB_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHB_spelltarget
attribs.current: Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range (in ascending order of their current hit points, ignoring unconscious creatures)

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHB_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHC_itemcontent
attribs.current:
If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.

A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.

Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHD_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHF_itemcontent
attribs.current:
If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.

A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.

Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RE6NRCSNFBoxHG_itemcontent
attribs.current: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RFEWMPiMDS9qms_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 20/60

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RFEWMPiMDS9qmt_itemcontent
attribs.current: A chest holds 12 cubic feet or 300 pounds of gear.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RFEWMPiMDS9qmu_itemcontent
attribs.current: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of parchment.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RFEWMPiMDS9qmy_itemcontent
attribs.current: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RGHgtQUF1t8he-_itemcontent
attribs.current: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4h0RGHgtQUF1t8he-_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 5, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/60

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4hYE8yDynRM4n-Wf1_description
attribs.current: Starting at 2nd level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn’t already include your proficiency bonus.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4hYE9tB67NxraXZE3_description
attribs.current: Beginning at 2nd level, you can use soothing music or oration to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d6 hit points.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4jA5bPJwPH5hZp7sl_description
attribs.current: Also at 3rd level, you learn how to use your wit to distract, confuse, and otherwise sap the confidence and competence of others. When a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a damage roll, you can use your reaction to expend one of your uses of Bardic Inspiration, rolling a Bardic Inspiration die and subtracting the number rolled from the creature’s roll. You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability check succeeds or fails, or before the creature deals its damage. The creature is immune if it can’t hear you or if it’s immune to being charmed.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4jA5cZcRXd6eIL4ix_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target’s person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4jA5cZcRXd6eIL4ix_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: An eyelash encased in gum arabic

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4jA5cZcRXd6eIL4ix_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4kgeeow8WQEo54abF_spelldescription
attribs.current: You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. Creatures that can’t be charmed are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do. You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn’t met before the spell expires, the activity isn’t performed. If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4kgeeow8WQEo54abF_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A snake's tongue and either a bit of honeycomb or a drop of sweet oil

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4kgeeow8WQEo54abF_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current: You thrive in front of an audience. You know how to entrance them, entertain them, and even inspire them. Your poetics can stir the hearts of those who hear you, awakening grief or joy, laughter or anger. Your music raises their spirits or captures their sorrow. Your dance steps captivate, your humor cuts to the quick. Whatever techniques you use, your art is your life.

attribs.name: additional_feature_and_traits
attribs.current:
Dwarf
Kingdoms rich in ancient grandeur, halls carved into the roots of mountains, the echoing of picks and hammers in mines and blazing forges, a commitment to clan and tradition, and hatred of goblins and orcs—these common threads are the heritage of every dwarf.
Bold and hardy, dwarves are known as skilled warriors, miners, and workers of stone and metal. They can live to be more than 400 years old, so the oldest living dwarves often remember a very different world.
Dwarves are solid and enduring, like the mountains they love, weathering the centuries with stoic endurance. Individual dwarves are determined and loyal, true to their word and committed in action, sometimes to the point of stubbornness.

Bard
Whether scholar, skald, or scoundrel, a bard weaves magic through words and music to inspire allies, demoralize foes, and even heal wounds. Not every minstrel singing in a tavern or jester cavorting in a royal court is a bard. Discovering the magic hidden in music requires hard study and some measure of natural talent that most troubadours and jongleurs lack. A bard’s life is spent wandering across the land gathering lore, telling stories, and living on the gratitude of audiences. After telling so many stories about heroes accomplishing mighty deeds, many bards take these themes to heart and assume heroic roles themselves.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qV3AOqlwQJAvtWID_description
attribs.current: You can cast a cleric spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qV3BfcyV1yWpZ7NG_description
attribs.current: Also starting at 1st level, your healing spells are more effective. Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains  additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-Lf4qV3BfcyV1yWpZ7NH_name
attribs.current: Heavy Armor, Medium Armor, Light Armor, Shields

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qV3BfcyV1yWpZ7NJ_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qV3BfcyV1yWpZ7NK_description
attribs.current: Elves don’t need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is “trance.”) While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qV3BfcyV1yWpZ7NL_description
attribs.current: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qV3BfcyV1yWpZ7NP_description
attribs.current: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-Lf4qV3BfcyV1yWpZ7NT_name
attribs.current: Longbow, Longsword, Shortbow, Shortsword, Simple Weapons

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qV3BfcyV1yWpZ7NV_description
attribs.current:
As an acolyte, you command the respect of those who share your faith, and you can perform the religious ceremonies of your deity. You and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free healing and care at a temple, shrine, or other established presence of your faith, though you must provide any material components needed for spells. Those who share your religion will support you (but only you) at a modest lifestyle.
You might also have ties to a specific temple dedicated to your chosen deity or pantheon, and you have a residence there. This could be the temple where you used to serve, or a temple where you have found a new home. While near your temple, you can call upon the priests for assistance, provided the assistance you ask for is not hazardous and you remain in good standing with your temple.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3d_spelldescription
attribs.current: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3d_spelltarget
attribs.current: Up to three creatures of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3d_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3e_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3e_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3f_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the ability check. The spell then ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3g_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3g_spelltarget
attribs.current: One object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3h_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3h_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3i_spelldescription
attribs.current: You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn’t understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it. Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can’t follow your command, the spell ends. Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you. Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn. Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means. Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn. Halt. The target doesn’t move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3i_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4qV3DYIdOhh9b6A3i_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3EZctt91YsOEDR_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Bludgeoning

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3EZctt91YsOEDS_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3EZctt91YsOEDT_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3EZctt91YsOEDT_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3EZctt91YsOEDU_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3EZctt91YsOEDW_itemcontent
attribs.current: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3EZctt91YsOEDY_itemcontent
attribs.current: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3FGj3TPunZd9DU_itemcontent
attribs.current: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3FGj3TPunZd9DV_itemcontent
attribs.current: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3FGj3TPunZd9DW_itemcontent
attribs.current: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3FGj3TPunZd9DW_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/40

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3FGj3TPunZd9DX_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3FGj3TPunZd9DY_itemcontent
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Lf4qV3FGj3TPunZd9DZ_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qcufFmHkmzWWH8Kc_description
attribs.current:
At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Turn Undead and an effect determined by your domain. Some domains grant you additional effects as you advance in levels, as noted in the domain description.
When you use your Channel Divinity, you choose which effect to create. You must then finish a short or long rest to use your Channel Divinity again.
Some Channel Divinity effects require saving throws. When you use such an effect from this class, the DC equals your cleric spell save DC.
Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests, and beginning at 18th level. you can use it three times between rests. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain your expended uses.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qcugnyNm5LTLgIfP_description
attribs.current:
As an action, you present your holy sym⁠bol and speak a prayer censuring the Undead. Each Undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.
A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can’t willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can’t take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there’s nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lf4qcugnyNm5LTLgIfR_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to heal the badly injured.
As an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your cleric level. Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can’t use this feature on an undead or a construct.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4qlyWOAVgw5x4GBmw_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4qlyWOAVgw5x4GBmx_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell’s effect resemble that weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4qlyWOAVgw5x4GBmx_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rT5E4TXcRiTSsFHT_spelldescription
attribs.current: For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any. The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4ropuTSRXf5NCMI2N_spelldescription
attribs.current: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4ropuTSRXf5NCMI2N_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4ropuTSRXf5NCMI2N_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rqed828fFifRnoKJ_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rqed828fFifRnoKJ_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature of your choice that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rqed828fFifRnoKJ_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rsAtvcCVacSHKXHb_spelldescription
attribs.current: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 necrotic damage.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rsAtvcCVacSHKXHb_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rub6OZLj6QP7asub_spelldescription
attribs.current: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can’t be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rub6OZLj6QP7asub_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rwnJPoFMlU8AurnP_spelldescription
attribs.current: You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn’t protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rxo0gHrZC8qsTeJY_spelldescription
attribs.current: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rxo0gHrZC8qsTeJY_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lf4rxo0gHrZC8qsTeJY_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4rzr9PkiL8rosmmYk_spelldescription
attribs.current: Your spell bolsters your allies with toughness and resolve. Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target’s hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 5 for the duration.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4rzr9PkiL8rosmmYk_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A tiny strip of white cloth

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4rzr9PkiL8rosmmYk_spelltarget
attribs.current: Up to three creatures within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4rzr9PkiL8rosmmYk_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, a target’s hit points increase by an additional 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sAAwlBv08QwHmase_spelldescription
attribs.current: Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sAAwlBv08QwHmase_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A small, straight piece of iron

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sAAwlBv08QwHmase_spelltarget
attribs.current: A humanoid that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sAAwlBv08QwHmase_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target on additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sCVkbpGLh6p4f4o4_spelldescription
attribs.current: By casting gem-inlaid sticks, rolling dragon bones, laying out ornate cards, or employing some other divining tool, you receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a specific course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses from the following possible omens: Weal, for good results Woe, for bad results Weal and woe, for both good and bad results Nothing, for results that aren’t especially good or bad The spell doesn’t take into account any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of additional spells or the loss or gain of a companion. If you cast the spell two or more times before completing your next long rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get a random reading. The DM makes this roll in secret.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sCVkbpGLh6p4f4o4_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Specially marked sticks, bones, or similar tokens worth at least 25 gp

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sSirXwVRkKOslnp7_spelldescription
attribs.current: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sSirXwVRkKOslnp7_spelltarget
attribs.current: 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sUBNaXqzhsoiYqW5_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw. An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Lf4sUBNaXqzhsoiYqW5_spelltarget
attribs.current: A 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current:
You have spent your life in the service of a temple to a specific god or pantheon of gods. You act as an intermediary between the realm of the holy and the mortal world. But you are not a cleric.
Work with your DM to detail the nature of your religious service. Were you a lesser functionary in a temple, raised from childhood to assist the priests in the sacred rites? Or were you a high priest who suddenly experienced a call to serve your god in a different way? Perhaps you were the leader of a small cult outside of any established temple structure, or even an occult group that served a fiendish master that you now deny.

attribs.name: additional_feature_and_traits
attribs.current:
Elf
Elves are people of otherworldly grace, living in the world but not entirely part of it. They live in places of ethereal beauty, in the midst of ancient forests or in silvery spires glittering with faerie light, where soft music drifts through the air and gentle fragrances waft on the breeze. Elves love nature and magic, art and artistry, music and poetry. Elves can live over 700 years. They are more often amused than excited, and more likely to be curious than greedy. They tend to remain aloof and unfazed by petty happenstance,
and they trust in diplomacy and compromise to resolve differences before they escalate to violence.
Most elves dwell in small forest villages hidden among the trees. Their contact with outsiders is usually limited, though a few elves make a good living by trading crafted items for metals, which they have no interest in mining.
Cleric
Clerics are intermediaries between the mortal world and the distant planes of the gods. As varied as the gods they serve, clerics strive to embody the handiwork of their deities. No ordinary priest or temple servant, a cleric is imbued with divine magic.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFDb0D36c3OUIJLAe5_desc
attribs.current: The demogorgon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFDfA1UbwuSWh60TjR_desc
attribs.current: The demogorgon has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn’t have all its hit points.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFDhe3JceDAp4G9rQX_desc
attribs.current: The demogorgon regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the demogorgon takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the demogorgon’s next turn. The demogorgon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFDoT6Jcv5Jz7qdLUP_description
attribs.current: The demogorgon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFE439EG77ZeITHlL8_description
attribs.current: The doppelganger makes two melee attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFE439EG77ZeITHlLA_description
attribs.current: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 ft. of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 ft. of wood or dirt, 2 ft. of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFE439EG77ZeITHlLB_desc
attribs.current: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFE439EG77ZeITHlLC_desc
attribs.current: In the first round of a combat, the doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFE439EG77ZeITHlLD_desc
attribs.current: If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFEhY1WSR6oPwQHIyt_desc
attribs.current:
The mage is a 4th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13; +5 to hit with spell attacks). The mage knows the following spells from the wizard’s spell list:
Cantrips (at will): light, mage hand, shocking grasp
1st Level (4 slots): charm person, magic missile
2nd Level (3 slots): hold person, misty step

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LfFEwjaeCBFJCSy83G0_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LfFEwjaeCBFJCSy83G0_spelltarget
attribs.current: One object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LfFEy3JKb4irUr7Z5w5_spelldescription
attribs.current: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again. You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it. The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LfFEy3JKb4irUr7Z5w5_spelltarget
attribs.current: A point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LfFEzRBUUiQxw35tzsV_spelldescription
attribs.current: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn.   ​The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LfFEzRBUUiQxw35tzsV_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature you try to touch

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFF-UTyVZg5h0g9gnj_spelldescription
attribs.current: You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFF-UTyVZg5h0g9gnj_spelltarget
attribs.current: A humanoid you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFF-UTyVZg5h0g9gnj_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFF1D5zmkIJU4n4G3U_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFF1D5zmkIJU4n4G3U_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature of your choice that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFF1D5zmkIJU4n4G3U_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LfFF2OqnzzVWlFJNCvl_spelldescription
attribs.current: Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

attribs.current: A small, straight piece of iron

attribs.current: A humanoid that you can see within range

attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target on additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.current: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

attribs.name: npc_senses
attribs.current: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFFMYOCkzhgEkOKoAe_description
attribs.current: The target must make a dc on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFFMYOCkzhgEkOKoAf_description
attribs.current: The target is restrained by webbing As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed - AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFFMYPE0Omv3TO4cuj_desc
attribs.current: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFFMYPE0Omv3TO4cuk_desc
attribs.current: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFFMYPE0Omv3TO4cul_desc
attribs.current: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

attribs.name: npc_condition_immunities
attribs.current: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone

attribs.name: npc_senses
attribs.current: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

attribs.name: repeating_npcreaction_-LfFFYkKWkXj1PRk1zzZ_desc
attribs.current: When a jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jellies if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly's, rounded down. New jellies are one size smaller than the original jelly.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFFYkKWkXj1PRk1zza_desc
attribs.current: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFFYkKWkXj1PRk1zzb_desc
attribs.current: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFFt5o106tpO3bMBDD_description
attribs.current: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFFt5o106tpO3bMBDG_desc
attribs.current: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

attribs.name: npc_languages
attribs.current: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFG4Xq2Ad3BsuUEhg3_description
attribs.current: The troglodyte makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFG4Xq2Ad3BsuUEhg6_desc
attribs.current: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFG4Xq2Ad3BsuUEhg7_desc
attribs.current: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troglodyte must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature’s next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LfFG4Xq2Ad3BsuUEhg8_desc
attribs.current: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFH4YapDslYIxdD3N1_description
attribs.current: The thessalhydra makes one maw attack and one Flurry of Bites.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFHTw42M1DEFdV1lET_description
attribs.current: The target is grappled. As an action, the target can escape the grapple by succeeding on a DC 14 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (its choice). Until this grapple ends, the thessalhydra can't use its tail pincer.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LfFHkZqeizZiaIfDtki_description
attribs.current: The thessalhydra spits a glob of acid at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction-l_-LfFHrOD7EfN0Uaqk-jR_description
attribs.current: The thessalhydra makes a Wisdom (Perception) check with advantage.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction-l_-LfFHwcvOmWiI9ldmYFb_description
attribs.current: The thessalhydra makes a tail pincer attack.

To this day, I will never leave a friend behind.\",\"My honor is my life.\",\"I’ll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.\",\"Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.\",\"I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.\"]}","background_flaw_choice_array":"{\"name\":\"Flaw\",\"array\":[\"The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.\",\"I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.\",\"I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many lives—and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.\",\"My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning.\",\"I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.\",\"I’d rather eat my armor than admit when I’m wrong.\"]}"},"repeating":["repeating_-LfFJFCCPBCPonioVcFj_topbar","repeating_-LfFJGuyEx8xSGCkG6y3_row","repeating_-LfFJGv0-gzIMvDDVswR_row","repeating_-LfFJGv16pPNUXpJikOO_row","repeating_-LfFJGvLpqU53ivRWKiq_background_tool"]},"l1-equipment":{"values":{"equipment_class":"Paladin","equipment_background":"Soldier","equipment_type":"class","starting_gold":"0","class_equipment_choice1":"Items:Longsword","class_equipment_choice5":"Items:Shield","class_equipment_choice2":"Items:Javelin (5)","class_equipment_choice3":"Items:Explorer's Pack"},"repeating":["repeating_-LfFJKtUsT-t-WZIKG4q_topbar"]},"l1-bio":{"values":{"previous_race":"Human","character_name":"Human Paladin"},"repeating":["repeating_-LfFJgfHZBJRTzTN2Nng_topbar"]},"l1-summary":{"values":{},"repeating":["repeating_-LfFJjeUGdh3SuXQ78g1_topbar"]}}

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFJzN65dCucF9bphNs_description
attribs.current:
Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your paladin level × 5.
As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in your pool.
Alternatively, you can expend 5 hit points from your pool of healing to cure the target of one disease or neutralize one poison affecting it. You can cure multiple diseases and neutralize multiple poisons with a single use of Lay on Hands, expending hit points separately for each one.
This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFJzN65dCucF9bphNt_description
attribs.current:
The presence of strong evil registers on your senses like a noxious odor, and powerful good rings like heavenly music in your ears. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect such forces. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any celestia⁠l, fiend, or undead within 60 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You know the type (celestial, fiend, or undead) of any being whose presence you sense, but not its identity (the vampi⁠re Count Strahd von Zarovich, for instance). Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been consecrated or desecrated, as with the hallow spell.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier. When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended uses.

attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-LfFJzN7TYO7OejXGatA_name
attribs.current: Heavy Armor, Medium Armor, Light Armor, Shields

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFJzN7TYO7OejXGatG_description
attribs.current: You have a military rank from your career as a soldier. Soldiers loyal to your former military organization still recognize your authority and influence, and they defer to you if they are of a lower rank. You can invoke your rank to exert influence over other soldiers and requisition simple equipment or horses for temporary use. You can also usually gain access to friendly military encampments and fortresses where your rank is recognized.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN8igkM9lOnFCTY_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Slashing, Alternate Damage: 1d10, Alternate Damage Type: Slashing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN8igkM9lOnFCTZ_itemcontent
attribs.current: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN8igkM9lOnFCTZ_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 30/120

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN8igkM9lOnFCTb_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN8igkM9lOnFCTD_itemcontent
attribs.current: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN9mGeUKW6PjF91_itemcontent
attribs.current: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN9mGeUKW6PjF92_itemcontent
attribs.current: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN9mGeUKW6PjF93_itemcontent
attribs.current: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN9mGeUKW6PjF93_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/40

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN9mGeUKW6PjF94_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN9mGeUKW6PjF95_itemcontent
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFJzN9mGeUKW6PjF96_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFLU7EYXPXkuMnmqyQ_description
attribs.current: Starting at 2nd level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8. The damage increases by 1d8 if the target is an undead or a fiend, to a maximum of 6d8.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7EYXPXkuMnmqyS_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7EYXPXkuMnmqyS_spelldescription
attribs.current: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7EYXPXkuMnmqyT_spelldescription
attribs.current: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is 3d8 for a 1st-level spell slot if the target is an undead or fiend.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFLU7F0f838mZVtlm3_description
attribs.current: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7F0f838mZVtlmQ_spelldescription
attribs.current: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7F0f838mZVtlmQ_spelltarget
attribs.current: Up to three creatures of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7F0f838mZVtlmQ_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7GARbzcrFMqR2N_spelldescription
attribs.current: You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn’t understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it. Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can’t follow your command, the spell ends. Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you. Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn. Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means. Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn. Halt. The target doesn’t move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7GARbzcrFMqR2N_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7GARbzcrFMqR2N_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7GARbzcrFMqR2O_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLU7GARbzcrFMqR2O_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFLbvVbHS5eAEmS6qo_description
attribs.current: By 3rd level, the divine magic flowing through you makes you immune to disease.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFLbvWSVWT4Z1vsN1L_description
attribs.current:
Though the exact words and strictures of the Oath of Devotion vary, paladins of this oath share these tenets.
Honesty. Don’t lie or cheat. Let your word be your promise.
Courage. Never fear to act, though caution is wise.
Compassion. Aid others, protect the weak, and punish those who threaten them. Show mercy to your foes, but temper it with wisdom.
Honor. Treat others with fairness, and let your honorable deeds be an example to them. Do as much good as possible while causing the least amount of harm.
Duty. Be responsible for your actions and their consequences, protect those entrusted to your care, and obey those who have just authority over you.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFLbvWSVWT4Z1vsN1M_description
attribs.current:
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.
As an action, you can imbue one weapon that you are holding with positive energy, using your Channel Divinity. For 1 minute, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls made with that weapon (with a minimum bonus of +1). The weapon also emits bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light 20 feet beyond that. If the weapon is not already magical, it becomes magical for the duration.
You can end this effect on your turn as part of any other action. If you are no longer holding or carrying this weapon, or if you fall unconscious, this effect ends.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LfFLbvWSVWT4Z1vsN1N_description
attribs.current:
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.
As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring fiends and undead, using your Channel Divinity. Each fiend or undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.
A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can’t willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can’t take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there’s nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLbvXnQw0Ikv-T-L-_spelldescription
attribs.current: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can’t be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLbvXnQw0Ikv-T-L-_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFLbvXnQw0Ikv-T-L0_spelldescription
attribs.current: You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn’t protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LfFLnWBhDXhsO9HZ8HL_itemcontent
attribs.current: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFMrQ4xaLAUTtPHnLg_spelldescription
attribs.current: For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any. The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFMserMMlMXBTP5a-Z_spelldescription
attribs.current: A willing creature you touch is imbued with bravery. Until the spell ends, the creature is immune to being frightened and gains temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of its turns. When the spell ends, the target loses any remaining temporary hit points from this spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFMserMMlMXBTP5a-Z_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFMu2en2hMKZMjzGBu_spelldescription
attribs.current: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFMu2en2hMKZMjzGBu_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LfFMu2en2hMKZMjzGBu_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature of your choice within range

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current: War has been your life for as long as you care to remember. You trained as a youth, studied the use of weapons and armor, learned basic survival techniques, including how to stay alive on the battlefield. You might have been part of a standing national army or a mercenary company, or perhaps a member of a local militia who rose to prominence during a recent war.

attribs.name: additional_feature_and_traits
attribs.current:
Human
Humans are the youngest of the common races, late to arrive on the world scene and short-lived in comparison to dwarves, elves, and dragons. But they are the innovators, the achievers, and the pioneers of the world.
Paladin
Whatever their origin and their mission, paladins are united by their paths to stand against the forces of evil. Whether sworn before a god’s altar and the witness of a priest, in a sacred glade before nature spirits and fey beings, or in a moment of desperation and grief with the dead as the only witness, a paladin’s oath is a powerful bond. It is a source of power that turns a devout warrior into a blessed champion.
Paladins train for years to learn the skills of combat, mastering a variety of weapons and armor. Even so, their martial skills are secondary to the magical power they wield: power to heal the sick and injured, to smite the wicked and the undead, and to protect the innocent and those who join them in the fight for justice.
